title: Douglas fir
summary: The Douglas fir (Pseudotsuga menziesii)[3] is an evergreen conifer species in the pine family, Pinaceae. It is native to western North America and is also known as Douglas-fir,[4] Douglas spruce,[5] Oregon pine,[6] and Columbian pine.[7] There are three varieties: coast Douglas-fir (P. menziesii var. menziesii), Rocky Mountain Douglas-fir (P. menziesii var. glauca) and Mexican Douglas fir (P. menziesii var. lindleyana).[8]
